descript.abstract: Outdoor areas used for recreation and conservation including parks, natural areas, golf courses, cemeteries, homeowner association owned parcels, trail parcels, school land, etc.
descript.purpose: In an attempt to address the need for increased functionality, a dataset was created for all protected lands within the Regional Conservation Framework nine county extent.
descript.supplinf: The source data units originated from the taxlot parcel and assessor information from each county.

idinfo.accconst: RLIS subscribers (See the RLIS Product Terms and Conditions)
idinfo.useconst: This database and GIS data are made available under the Open Database License (ODbL v1) and Database Content License (DbCL v1). See http://www.oregongmetro.gov/rlis-live.

horizpa.horizpar: Registered to tax lots. Street center lines were digitized from aerial orthophotography at +/- 10 feet accuracy. Tax lots were fit to the street centerlines. Beaverton, Oregon City and Tigard planning areas were improved to +/- 5 feet accuracy. Multnomah County was created with coordinate geometry using better control.

procstep.procdesc: Original data set published to RLIS Live.

attr.attrdef: Proper name of the site. No abbreviations. Sites are groups of units that share a common name. Sites may be non-contiguous and have more than one owner or manager.
Classification title used to more specifically describe the unit.

edom.edomvd: Area designated as a burying ground
Area designated as a golf course
Area owned by a private homeowner association.

Area managed primarily for value of natural resources as buffers, conservation and/or habitat protection; may or may not have access by people to experience nature; sitename used by owner or manager contains the word Natural Area; e.g. Tryon Creek State Natural Area, Smith & Bybee Wetlands Natural Area, Oaks Bottom Wildlife Refuge

Area not specifically designated for any other unit type or unknown; e.g. privately owned plats, transportation corridor buffers, trail/path parcels not large enough to be part of a park or natural area

Active or passive recreation area where facilities exist primarily intended for recreational uses by the public; sitename used by owner or manager contains the word Park; e.g. -Washington Park, Oxbow Regional Park, Tom McCall Waterfront Park, Mt. Tabor Park, Stub Stewart State Park, Springwater Corridor, Forest Park, Mt. Talbert Nature Park, Powell Butte Nature Park,
Area owned by school/district

attr.attrdef: Specific proper name of parcel owner including bureau or sub-unit of government

edom.edomvd: Owned by a American Indians, or Indian tribes
Owned by federal government or agency
Owned by regional, county or city jurisdictions
Owned by non-profit organization
Owned by private individual or business
Owned by a special district government, e.g., THPRD, NCPRD, etc.
Owned by state government or agency
Owner unknown from assessor information
Owned by city government or agency
Owned by county government or agency
Owned by non-profit organization primarily with a conservation focus ie) TNC, Land Trusts, Conservancies
Land Owned by Non-profit though not Conservation focused; ex. Religious Organization
Owned by other federal government or agency ie) Postal service Dept of Defense
Owned by other special districts like Clean Water Services, Fire District, Port of Portland
Owned by special park district, eg. THPRD, NCPRD, GPRD
Owned by home owners association
Privately owned open space or recreation land
Owned by Metro
Owned by school district or agency
Owned by State Forestry Department
Owned by State Parks and Recreation Department
Owned by the US Fish and Wildlife
Owned by the US Forest Service
Owner is unknown

attr.attrdef: Proper name of organization that manages the parcel
Name of city, town or community where the parcel exists.
Proper name of the county where the parcel physically exists.
Area in acres of the parcel calculated by GIS software.
Current physical state of the parcel regarding access.

edom.edomvd: Parcel is not open to the public.
Parcel is open to the public, free of charge
Parcel is not specifically closed to the public, but access is restricted except by permit or reservation.
Status of the parcel is unknown.

attr.attrdef: Indicates parcels acquired through Metro Bond Measure Acquisitions

edom.edomvd: Not Metro Bond Measure Acquisition
Metro Bond Measure Acquisition

attr.attrdef: Protection level for an area of importance for wildlife, flora, fauna or features of geological or other special interest, which is reserved and managed for conservation and to provide special opportunities for study or research. May or may not have access for people to experience nature.

edom.edomvd: Property has substantial level of known conservation efforts; e.g. Forest Park, Tryon Creek State Natural Area, Smith & Bybee Wetlands Natural Area, Graham Oaks Nature Park, Powell Butte Nature Park
Property has low level of conservation; e.g. golf courses, Tom McCall Waterfront Park, Cemeteries

Property has a medium level of conservation, including parks with natural elements, undeveloped parcels with natural habitat, and natural areas without known conservation effort; e.g. Mt. Tabor Park, Laurelhurst Park, BLM Land
Property has unknown level of conservation;

attr.attrdef: Level of recreational development on a property

edom.edomvd: Property has no level of impact from recreational development or access is known to be blocked; e.g. Mt Hood Wilderness Area

Property has a low level of impact from recreational development, with possibly a few trails, but recreation is not the primary purpose of the parcel; e.g. Chehalem Ridge Natural Area, Audobon Society Lands, Forest Service Lands
Property has unknown level of impact from recreational development; e.g. HOAs

Property has substantial level of impact from recreational development with known recreational features like playground equipment or large grassy areas; e.g. Washington Park, Blue Lake Regional Park, Oxbow Regional Park, Mt. Tabor Park

distinfo.distliab: The information in this file was derived from digital databases on Metro's GIS. Care was taken in the creation of this file. Metro cannot accept any responsibility for errors, omissions, or positional accuracy. There are no warranties, expressed or implied.

onlinopt.accinstr: Email drc@oregonmetro.gov or call 503-797-1742 for further instructions.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
